review_text: Our stay in London was wonderful, thanks to Jacqueline's top-notch hosting. The house was easy to find, and it was beautiful to wind through the hills and mountains to get there. When we arrived, it was simple to enter the home. Jacqueline left lamps on for us, and the air conditioning was onâ€”we felt everything was ready for us. The house was impeccably clean and very comfortable. Our kids loved the bunk room and had a blast playing the old school arcade games. The icing on the cake was the breathtaking view of the mountains and the surrounding farms. We had fun with the wildlife, too: the cows (and calfs!) peacefully grazing, a turkey wandering around the woods, and a curious lizard climbing the stairs outside. The price was just right, and we didn't break the bank to relish in Kentucky beauty. Thank you!

review_text: I know I've given this a 5 star rating but, somehow, that does not seem to be enough. From the location, to the home itself, to the people, this was a wonderful experience for my family. While we were dealing with a tough family situation, we found great peace in just being together in this wonderful setting. No matter what window you look out, you just see beautiful countryside. I'm not sure I have the words to do accurately describe our experience. The home itself is very cute and cozy. From the moment we walked in, my wife raved about it. My kids were apprehensive when I told them where we were staying, but immediately fell in love with the place. From the woods behind the house to the cows in the pasture beside the house, it was breathtaking. We are already in the process of planning our next trip!

review_text: Jacquelines home was like home away from home. We made our reservation to have a place to rest overnight on our long drive to the Smokey Mountains, however, we wouldn't have minded staying longer. It was very easy to find because of excellent directions, and very easy to check-in. We were so pleased when we went inside and saw how clean and welcoming it was. The treats were definitely a surprise and we thought very kind of her to leave for us. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were soft and seemed like high quality sheets. This was our first experience with an Airbnb home and was a great way to start. Definitely better than staying at a hotel! We will happily recommend Jacquelines home to others and will make our reservations there in the future when traveling thru this area. We would like to know if Jacqueline has other homes in other locations that we can use for future trips. Such a great place for the price! Thank you.

review_text: This is the our 3rd stay at Jacqueline's Airbnb. We have never stayed at an Airbnb more than once. Here are my pros and cons of staying here. Pros: 1} Jacqueline is always proactive in the upkeep of her Airbnb. We have stayed at many places where it was most probably great at the beginning, but over times the host have just let things slide. The last time we stayed here was in May and since then, she has had curtains put up over the existing blinds in the bedrooms, a screen door installed over the back door, and a new thermostat in place; 2) Jacqueline is highly communicative with any questions you may have; 3) she reads ALL of the reviews and actually act on any areas of concern and 4) we just found out she has a second Airbnb right next door !! Here are my Cons: NONE !!!!!

And it really helps that their is a dollar general literally down the same road and it's walking distance or a 2 minute drive and carries everything you need even groceries you could get at your local Walmart or Krogers! All other stores, restaurants, and local fun outings are all a average 20 minute drive from the property which really isn't far at all! Jacqueline at the property owner of the Airbnb was he really super nice and very communicative and gave very good details instructions through the process from start to end!

Being in a different state, she had sent friends to help and asked neighbors to use their Wi-Fi without any luck after 3 hours of trying. Our trip was a trip where we needed internet connections, a good night sleep, and a comfortable place to sit and eat which we didn't get. So unfortunately, we had to cancel our stay. She had given us most of our money back which helped. I think once she gets full internet, changes her plastic covers, a different seating option, and gets screens for her windows her place will be absolutely beautiful. Aubrey was a life saver & her friends were GREAT!

There are 3 bedrooms which all had great personal touches. Bathroom was very clean and tons of beautiful plush towels. FYI, the hot water in the shower is on the right and cold on the leftğŸ˜Š. Tons of snacks provided plus water bottles which was a great added plus. We did not interact with Arlene during our stay as we did not need anything, but she was home and available if we did need her.
The only negative was the stairs at the fire pit on the hill. If you have any trouble walking, this is not for you if you want to use it. It is steep with no handrails and there is a sign that read â€œNot responsible for any injuriesâ€. I am handicapped so I could not use it and it was not in the description.

review_text:
Arleneâ€™s place was a half way meeting point from my home in Ohio to my sonâ€™s family in Tennessee. We agreed to meet in London for a visit and it couldnâ€™t have been more perfect.
Arlene has a gift of hospitality and it shows from the very moment you walk in the door. The apt was spotless, accent lights were on throughout the home, the place smelled wonderful and there were fresh snacks and cold waters in the fridge.
We really felt as if we were her special guests although she had never met us.
Communication was clear and prompt. Arlene welcomed my grandchildren ages almost 3 and 5 and had a shelf full of books and age appropriate toys. You can tell she values children- there was a high chair, pac nâ€™ play, baby tub and rocking chair at our disposal. All in excellent condition and clean as a whistle. Oh! And she had a great selection of childrenâ€™s movies to enjoy in the evening.
The apt is spacious, well decorated and within walking distance to a park, ice cream shop and a great date place- â€œLocal Honeyâ€ - great food and excellent atmosphere. London is a sweet little gem for sure.
As you can tell by the length of my review I was very pleased with our stay.
Thank you, Arlene for sharing your home and town with us! London is blessed to have you!

review_text: This is a comfortable and very well cared for airbnb. It is very clean, well equipped and tidy and has everything you'd need for a good stay. It is very close to the heart of London. Arlene provided a big plate of honey buns from the local bakery for us which was very kind of her and there was water and condiments in the fridge. The rooms are large and the main living space runs the length of the building. Do be aware that it is somewhat of a basement apartment with only the front bedroom having a proper window. The bathroom and utility room have small, high, windows. Also the air conditioning is set in the main house. Arlene very kindly offers to change this for her guests if they text her, but as we do tend to yoyo with the heating (I feel the cold and my husband does not) we didn't like to be always asking her to change it and there were lovely, soft blankets on hand for me to keep cosy with, whilst watching the TV. The AC unit is just next to the kitchen and is very powerful at times. Husband loved it!

name: Lisa
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
April 2024
,
Â·
Group trip
review_text: We had a great stay at Tyler's home. I was surprised with the location being on a very winding road but hey, it's Kentucky! We came in to ride at Wildcat Off-road Park and it was a 20 minute ride on the sxs's to the park. The house was very clean and accommodating. All appliances worked as they should-the fridge does make a fair amount of ice, inside & outside lighting was great, & the location was very quiet. A few things that would not stop us from coming back but worth mentioning - the shower in the "laundry room" is small for a larger person - I would suggest using the hall bathroom/shower. The stairs to the upstairs loft are very small and steep and to get to the stairs, you have to go through the front bedroom. Bring extra paper towels and toilet paper with you as you shouldn't depend on the owner to provide a lot for you (I failed there). Although we brought our own pans and casserole dishes, it would be helpful to have a new full set of pots, lids, and skillets in the house.

review_text:
My wife and I booked a short getaway to London KY for some winter hiking and enjoyed our stay here. The hosts were quick to respond after there were issues with the keypad batteries being dead.
The space was exactly as described and included everything we needed including morning coffee. There was enough room for the two of us and our dog to stay comfortably for a few days. The patio was also nice to enjoy our morning coffee.
The neighborhood dogs may make an appearance and are friendly. Consequently light sleepers might hear the dogs barking when the sun comes up but we were able to drown it out with box fan that was provided.
Overall the stay and the hosts were great. They were friendly and provided us with local hikes and bars/restaurants. If looking for local bars/restaurants in London, Local Honey and Pour Boys are great spots.

review_text:
I'm giving this 5 stars because I can't give it 10! This was by far the nicest, most thoughtfully appointed Airbnb I have ever rented. She has gone WAY above and beyond. This felt less like renting a house and more like being a treasured guest in someone's home.
It's in an out-of-the-way place but that's a big part of the charm. The house sits in a beautiful setting and is extremely well-maintained. It looked like new construction or new renovation.
We LOVED the back porch and fire bowl. We sat out there and enjoyed them both nights of our stay.
The beds were extremely comfortable, the kitchen was very well stocked. We cooked a couple of meals there and had no problem finding everything and doing what we needed to do.
And the extras... There were snacks, coffee, spices, juice, even a first aid kit! This place has it ALL.
Kay clearly takes hospitality seriously and that helped give my family a terrific weekend. If I ever need an Airbnb in that town again it will be this one.

The Mountain Laurel Cottage really put the BnB back in AirBnB. The first thing that stood out was that there were many great options left there for us for breakfast including fresh fruit, orange juice and water, oatmeal, cereal and milk, and plenty for our whole family (all 7 of us).
We were very impressed by the beautiful decorations in the house, it just made our experience there very lovely. Very comfortable beds with beautiful covering made for an excellent place to rest. Comfortable couches made a. nice place to sit, and a well stocked kitchen were great for a place to eat. The cottage is in a pretty part of the country in Kentucky, so a lovely place to drive to and stay.
We also found so many little touches, she really thought of everything. A tub of missing toiletries, candies in every room, everything you might need. We plan to come again the next time we travel through Kentucky.
Kay worked quickly to put us up as we requested booking at the very last minute.

We enjoyed our stay very much. It was quiet and secluded. We enjoyed sitting out back in the morning listening to the birds sing. The front porch area was wonderful for relaxing, cooking out on the grill and enjoying the hot tub in the evening.
Michella was very responsive and quick to respond with any questions we had.
The place has everything you need for cooking meals or grilling. The master bathroom has a wonderful multi head shower. The whirlpool bath was nice to soak in. We appreciated that she had new toothbrushes in the bathroom because I had forgotten mine.
With corn hole, darts and a trail to walk right out the back fence there are lots of things to keep yourself and the family entertained. There are board games to play too. We didn't watch any T. V. but it was nice having one in the master bedroom and living room. The master bedroom bed was very comfortable.
If you like a place that is quiet and secluded this is the place to stay.
Motorcycle friendly.

review_text: We absolutely LOVED staying at the Olive Grove House in London, KY. This was a very well appointed airbnb! We stay in about a dozen vacation rentals throughout the country each year and this was one of the best we've stumbled on to yet. Very clean, extremely comfortable beds, pillows and linens. The living room had two large sofas, again very comfortable with a easy to use large smart tv. A huge garage, we'd typically not use a garage, but with the possibility of hail we figured why not?! After traveling for a few days it was wonderful to catch up on some laundry, beautiful brand new machines (well everything in the house seemed brand new!). The house was amazingly well stocked! Laundry detergent, dish washer soap, every travel sized toiletry you could ever dream of needing, coffee & tea and the list goes on... we are traveling with our special needs kids service dogs, whom couldn't be happier roaming around the huge fenced-in backyard. Every detail was A+++++

,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: Thoroughly enjoyed our 7 night stay. The home is in a nice and quiet neighborhood and is very close to the Levis Jackson Wilderness Road park. I enjoyed exercising our dog on the many well maintained trails in the park as well as visiting the very picturesque Old Mill on the stream within the park where photography opportunities were unlimited. One especially nice feature of the home was the especially large grassy fully fenced back yard for pets. The kitchen was also a plus as it contained all new appliances and was amply furnished with several extra touches/conveniences. We enjoyed several meals on the deck off the kitchen which was private & had attractive & comfortable outdoor furnishings. The two car garage was convenient as we had some stormy weather. Beds were quite comfortable & situated at opposite ends of the home, both had baths. Access to the washer & dryer was appreciated as well. Should we ever revisit London, this home will be our first choice.

Overall a great stay! We were unable to get into the house upon arrival due to an issue with the security system. The host was extremely helpful and quickly responsive to fix the issue. He explained that it is being fixed! The house is very cute and in a great location. Our only complaint was the cleanliness of the floors. We have a little one that crawls and this caused us to be more aware of it. I did reach out to the host and they were positively receptive and were going to deep clean!
My dad grew up in the house and we loved getting to hear stories of his time spent there! We loved that most things within the house had been preserved with modern decorations and updates where needed. We recommend this location as a place to stay if you are in London! We would love to stay again some time!

Kitchen was stocked, but lacking in a couple items (e.g., crock pot, cooking oil, and other specific things you may need.) That said, it does have basic pots/pans and utensils. Overall, cozy house and easy to sleep in. Perfect for me and my friends while attending a local wedding.

review_text:
We came to London due to some family issues and I was so thankful to find such a welcoming place to stay. The home is just a few minutes from all the restaurants and stores. Itâ€™s about 35 min to Cumberland falls. There is a great park to walk at or take the kids to play just a couple minutes away. (Veterans park).
The home has gorgeous natural lighting. A great fire pit and grill. We loved it there and will definitely stay again.
Iâ€™m other reviews, I read issues about the hot water in the shower. We had no issues. Let the shower run for a few minutes and the water will get hot. It does take a few minutes though. The host also went above and beyond by supplying shampoo, conditioner and body wash!
The kitchen had everything we needed plus some. I was surprised by the welcome snacks and coffee bar set up! Such a great perk that we truly appreciated.
The host went above and beyond for us! Definitely recommend.

The complimentary snack cart was a big hit too. :) Parking is a little tight but workable for more than one car. I would have liked a washer/dryer on site but everything else was just excellent. name: Leming & Max
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2020
,
Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
Jordyneâ€™s place was great found! We highly recommend you to stay at this place if it is available. It is a very neat and comfortable house that gets almost everything you need for your stay! We also discovered our new love bourbon through the sampler (thanks Daniel!) The Airbnb is located in the center of London, very close to everything within walking distance or less than 10 minutes' driving. We had a very great month staying at the place.
About The Living:
People in London are very friendly and hospitable. It was a very very safe place in town since it was surrounded by courthouses and police stations.
We strongly recommended the Sacred Cafe, where has the slowest service we've ever experienced, but it worth the waiting for the fantastic staff and their amazing considerate serving.
Grocery: Apparently London has various very good farmers' markets, but they closed in the wintertime during our stay. We recommended the Kroger at 1732 KY-192, great produce, and way better than the other Kroger.
The Only Downside: The only downside for our stay was the lack of laundry accessibility. The laundry mat in London is the most expensive laundries we have ever visited, the nearby town as well.
FYI: Don't forget to try out the bourbons while you are in Kentucky! They are so good!! Ask for recommendations or search for the local-limited addition info.

review_text: WARNINGâ€¼ï¸ WORST AIRBNB EXPERIENCE! It started out fine, although it was very cold. Olivia brought some space heaters and we used them continually, wore big coats and boots inside the house, and bought electric blankets. We were not told prior to arriving that the house had heating issues. On Christmas morning, the heat completely stopped. Oliviaâ€™s father finally called me and said that it was Christmas, and they couldnâ€™t get anybody to fix it, and said he could bring some more space heaters. It was far too cold, even with heaters (55 degrees and dropping), so I asked for a refund so I could leave and go to a hotel. I did not receive ANY response, so I reached out to Airbnb for help. Iâ€™m still waiting on help with this issue, and was out a lot more money staying at a hotel the remainder of my trip. Heating issues are understandable, but not responding to your guest or attempting to help them when they are WITHOUT HEAT in subzero temperatures is unacceptable. DO NOT STAY HERE!

And, at least for me, nothing was done to help the situation, even when I asked. I like dogs, but don't have any need for rude behavior. The farm animals were great, friendly, and enjoyable.

What an adorable retreat! This Tiny Home was expertly done to every detail. The porch with its country view as a backdrop to the lightning storm, falling asleep to rain tinkling on the tin roof, waking to a stocked coffee bar, freshening up in the large shower, puppies and goats and ponies and a donkey Hee-Hawing at me while I played guitar in one of the rocking chairsâ€¦
Diann waked by unobtrusively once and we chatted; a lovely lady and considerate hostess.
The home was very clean and well stocked. Mini fridge, gas stove, wonderful sunk Country sink, plenty enough counter space and all the cooking utensils youâ€™ll need. And a microwave, of course.
The decor is just lovely. Marble, marble everywhere! Classic, comfortable Country furniture that went mostly unused due to that wonderful porch. I think we slept better on the comfortable Full-size bed than our own Queen.
And yes, Pizza will be delivered!

review_text:
I highly recommend Diann's tiny house as a convenient, spotless, modern place to stay. It's so lovely out on the farm but close to I 75 and all the hiking and Cumberland Falls. It's not far to the main restaurants and shopping in London and it's also easy to get to Corbin from the house. This is a great place for one or two people to stay and Diann is a thoughtful host; she has lots of nice touches: rocking chairs on the porch, gas logs inside, adjustable A/C and ceiling fans, large shower and modern kitchen with fridge, microwave, stove and farmsink. I loved it!
A few pointers for guests: bring your own shampoo and conditioner and be ready to climb into bed from one side only as it's in a corner. Parking is right next to the porch and Diann will give you great directions to get to the house. Enjoy!

Stayed over a week
review_text:
Thank you so much for the wonderful home! It was great staying there, and this was my first Airbnb. I am sold on it now. The access to the location was wonderful and provided easy travel for my first trip since March 7, 2020. It was nice being back in Kentucky after the longest stretch of not being home (since 2018). I got to see lots of friends and family in the area, some I had not seen since 1983. Thank you for making the stay a simple part of the trip.
It was nice being able to cook, do laundry, and even stream some shows as I was adjusting to the time difference. The house was very clean, and the rooms were very nice. The dining room became a good office for me, and I greatly appreciated being able to have fast Internet. I felt confident that if any issues came up, I could reach out to y'all for assistance.
Thank you so much for sharing your home!
Peace and blessings,
Paul H. White, Ph.D.

review_text: I have stayed at dozens of Airbnbs throughout the world and this is by far one of the best I've been to. The house is right in downtown but is quiet, clean, and in wonderful condition. I definitely plan on staying here again in the future on my next visit and you should too!

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We had a fantastic stay at Blue Moon London. The place was incredibly equipped, we could walk to dinner and plenty of hiking within an hours drive.
Daniel had great recommendations for dinner and activities. We ate at Local Honey on Main Street 2 nights, a must visit for dinner, friendly staff, great chef and owners.
The kitchen had everything we needed, easy for us make breakfast in the mornings and we made and took a picnic lunch for our hikes.
Daniel was easy to communicate with and made everything so easy.
We would highly recommend Blue Moon and will be back on our Kentucky adventure.
